item.title: Hey look, my first review!
item.description:
As far as I’m aware, this is my very first review.

[Extinct Doesn’t Mean Forever][2] is an anthology of 19 stories exploring the concept of extinction, with genres ranging from far future SF to others that happily straddle the line between speculative fiction and the mainstream.

…

The second half of the book slows down somewhat. Some of the stories are longer and some of them frankly wear out their welcome. Stories I particularly enjoyed include Adam Israel’s “Indigo’s Gambit” and Shona Snowden’s “Blood Fruit”. Peter Dudley’s humorous “Distractions” makes for a satisfying finale.

How thrilling!

[2]: http://www.amazon.com/Extinct-Doesnt-Mean-Forever-ebook/dp/B004SUOWMU
